dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Builds his confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol disembarks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she walks and turns a corner.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: The shot of the prisoner taking the walk toward the death chamber. But the prisoner -- has grit -- her knees do  not buckle. She does not whimper. No prison "screws"  will have to support her weight. Still, the prospect  couldn't be grimmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melvin next to a spiffy convertible. Top down. Trunk open

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is wearing driving gloves and turns to witness the  tussle Frank and Simon are having just inside the  building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry that I'm not taking  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I, Frank. Frank starts to leave -- Simon stops him. They embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soak it up -- it's your last  chance at a hug for a few days. As Frank moves off Melvin sees Carol and his demeanor  changes... that quickly there is a shyness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for being on time... Carol,  the waitress, this is Simon, the  fag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... Oh, my God, who did that  to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, uh... I was... attacked.  Walked in on people robbing me. I  was hospitalized. I almost died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do the small talk in the  car. Load up. Carol puts her bag in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to do that for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. No problem. Where  should we sit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (totally non-plussed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -- uh, I... Well, there is no  place cards or anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Simon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go in back. You look like  you need all the room you can  manage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never a break. Never. Carol steps into the back. Melvin disappointed that he's  not sitting next to Carol... Carol is wedged in the small back seat. She struggles to get her feet in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really jammed back there. He reaches for the latch between his legs and slides his  seat and, with some effort,  wrenches it forward giving  Carol more room and putting his right against the wheel.  She is startled by the gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Simon finishes dialing the phone... a brief wait, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, hi, Mom -- I can barely  hear you. Do you have to whisper?  No -- don't apologize -- it was  the luckiest thing for all of us  that you didn't answer last  night... I can't hear you... okay,  dear, just listen to me then.

dialogues.speaker: ON MELVIN AND CAROL
dialogues.text: Melvin has been reduced to straight talk as Carol brings  the bathroom bounty into the room and begins to put it in her suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get why you're angry. It's no  snap to explain why I was like  that, but let's not try to do it  on the run...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... so Mom. Truly no grudges --  truly. A little odd that you  didn't come to see me when you  heard I was hurt, but the  important thing I want you to know  is your son is happy. I'm working  again. I'll make do -- I don't  want a thing. Wouldn't take it if  it was offered. I'll drop you a  note from wherever I land and then  it's up to you. I hope we patch  things up but know that if we  don't, I wish you both the very  best... I can't hear you. You  heard me, though, right? Good --  take good care. 'Bye. He hangs up, totally satisfied with himself and rips over to Carol and Melvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Now he's going to want to  stay. And they'll want to take a  ride to the lake or whatever. So  it's a good five hours back. It  gives us a chance to take it easy  and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going back with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of myself --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? You  got real problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm a little bit nervous.  Suddenly everything seems so easy.  Carol, a load has been lifted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One night with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're kidding. Melvin stalks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car parked near a phone booth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Frank over  the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aww Jesus! No choice. Carol walks up to Simon in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a gift for you. She hands him a base ball cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing like no choice to make you  feel at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Simon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see... Ahh, gorgeous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it then. Get the dog picked  up. I can't believe you let it  stay there. Melvin hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye. (to Simon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, your luck is holding. They  sublet your place. You're  homeless. Frank's got a line on  another place you can use for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another place where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it matter? Melvin gets in -- goes to the glove compartment for a  special CD labelled "For Emergency Use Only." As it  PLAYS a confessional love SONGS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to hear that music  right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? You said you  liked it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one has a special meaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your car but I don't want to  hear it. If that means anything. Melvin hesitates and then turns OFF the SONG in mid- proclamation of love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the car arrives... They get out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here are the keys to my apartment.  I'm going to park you in my place  while I take Carol home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hefting bag)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take a bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take you... why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what you did for me.  I don't think I want to know you  anymore -- all you do is make me  feel badly about myself. (turning to Simon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have my number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hugging her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you...  (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him take you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't want to. I love you. She shakes her head and walks off. Simon looking at  Melvin with some sympathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Verdell's ears prick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to go on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I've got to get a hold of  Frank and see where I'm hanging my  hat 'cause...  The door opens, revealing them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you gotta camp it here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? The dog vaults toward them -- all else forgotten as the  dog greets his two favorite people and they talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Verdell)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the feeling -- you feel  like your ol' self again, huh? -- Mommy and Daddy are home. Melvin reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... You're fun to mess with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melvin gets up... Simon notices some of his paintings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took your place furnished.  Jackie said she grabbed your  personal stuff -- they were  supposed to set you up here. (leading the way)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's this extra room -- I  never use. It gets good light.  No other answer really. Simon follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they enter... the room clean and organized -- a small  but lovely garret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Melvin. You overwhelm  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They did a nice job... Cozy, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. Melvin looks at him finally -- pretensions fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you, buddy, I'd be the  luckiest guy alive if that did it  for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Carol unpacks, she gives gifts to her mother and  Spencer. But clearly something gnaws at her psyche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melvin's two digital clocks are two minutes apart... each around 1:55 a.m... He sits in a chair still fully  dressed... forlorn... Verdell in his lap. A beat then we  hear Simon's whispered voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is my big hairy boy? Melvin is alarmed. He stops breathing as his gay housegue approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verdell, sweeties? Melvin breathes again. Simon enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, didn't know you were awake.  I just thought Verdell shouldn't  get too used to sleeping in here  'cause then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we both want the dog --  and...  The PHONE RINGS... they look at each other. Melvin  doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I get it? Melvin nods. Simon walks into the next room... several  beats as he finds the phone. We hear him pick it up and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. It's me. He took me in.  Did you know? Hold on, I'll get  him for you. He walks back to Melvin's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Carol. Melvin is quickly out of his chair -- the dog in one  mitt... he thrusts it at Simon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Take the dog. As he speeds him out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Melvin picks up the phone... He clears his throat  loudly. Following is INTERCUT between Carol and Melvin  -- the first such CUT showing Carol blasted by the throat clearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very concerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can trust my brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That seems like a good choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know whether I'm being  sensible or hard on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two might go together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See. There's an example. I don't  know whether you're being cute or  crazy now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (what the hell)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to answer  everything I say. Just listen to  me. Okay? He nods his head, "yes."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really something that you're  looking after Simon. And what I  said on the street. That was a  bad thing to say. And it made me  sick to my stomach. It was a bad  thing to say. And I'd be lying if  I didn't say that I enjoyed your  company... but the truth is you do  bother me enormously and I know --  think -- that it's best for me to  not have contact with you because  you're just not ready and you're a  pretty old guy to not be ready...  and I'm too old to ignore that.  But there were extraordinary  kindnesses that did take place.  So thanks for the trips...  She's just broken up with him but she's being nicer than  ever. It's hard to know whether to die or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay to say something now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should've danced with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long. Carol hangs up. She feels strange. A shoe hasn't dropped. Oh, hell... she missed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melvin walks in anxious circles in the living room. He  is impatient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to come talk to me or  not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming. We enters the room carrying Verdell who strains to be  allowed closer to Melvin. Simon releases him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did she say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a great guy --  "extraordinary"...  (before Simon can  celebrate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and she doesn't want contact  with me. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dying here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because...  (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... you love her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... and you're supposed to be  sensitive and sharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... you tell me why -- (mimics him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You're dying here."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... Let me sleep on it  and figure it out. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm stuck! Can't go back  to what I had... She's evicted me  from my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you like it that much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was better than this... Look,  you, I'm very intelligent. If  you're going to give me advice or  conversation or consolation or  hope, you got to be better than  you're doing. If you can't be at  least momentarily interesting than  shut the hell up. I'm drowning  and you're describing water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting pissed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picking on me won't help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if that's true then I'm  really in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you know where you're lucky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who you want. I'll take  your seat any day. So do  something... don't sleep on it...  go over there. I don't think  anybody should ever sleep on  anything -- it's not always good  to let things calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... I'm charged here. But she  might kill me for showing up this  late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get in your jammies and I'll  read you a story... I think you've  got a chance. The only real enemy  you have is her ability to think  logically -- the best thing you  have going for you is your  willingness to humiliate yourself  if it gives you one chance in  whatever -- so go catch her off- guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Thanks a lot. Here I go. He moves for the door... stops suddenly, jolted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot to lock the door.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: As he parks. He exits the car -- now wary... looks at  his watch... hesitates... walks reluctantly into the  apartment house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Melvin looks at Carol's doorbell with great  uncertainty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol in a cotton wrap-around dress/bathrobe... sitting  directly in front of a fan... the windows open, reading  one of Melvin's books...  There is the briefest possible sound of a DOORBELL...  someone has jabbed her downstairs button ever so briefly  -- so briefly that she's not certain it's her DOORBELL -- until the same brief sound REPEATED... She walks to  her wide open window and looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convertible at the curb.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: She hesitates --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Melvin gives up and starts out... turning as the  sudden blast of being BUZZED into Carol's life sounds.  He bolts for the door and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door... she hears the sound of MELVIN  SOUNDING HEAVILY up the stairs... He reaches her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want, Melvin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you asleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause if you were asleep -- I'm  sorry. And you could be grouchy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grouchy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... 'Cause of being woken up, and  it would make my job impossible.  So then I wouldn't even try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you asleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly in the hallway looking on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I woke you -- some other  time. He half turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't asleep!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a break...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (losing it a bit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it a secret what you're doing  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to see you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It relaxes me... I'd feel better  just sitting on the curb in front  of your house than anyplace else  I can think of or imagine. Carol has not ever heard anything like that before...  it's sort of sexy in its sincerity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we see in the b.g. that Beverly, standing near her  door down the hallway, has heard at least this last  part...  Melvin, of course, cannot leave well enough alone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, I'm overstating  here, maybe the inside stairs. I  don't want to sit with my feet in  the gutter. What does that serve?  It only...  But suddenly Carl is shouting to the heavens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!! Why can't I have a  normal boyfriend??? Why? Get out  of here. Just a regular boyfriend  who doesn't go nuts on me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (butting in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody wants that, dear -- it  doesn't exit...  (as Carol turns  to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... didn't mean to interrupt. She disappears into her room. Carol snorts a laugh --  gathers herself. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on in and try not to ruin  everything by being you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we could live without the  wise cracks. She looks at him -- then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we could...  Melvin glances at the cracked pattern of Carol's kitchen  linoleum and stalls at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It feels a little confined here.  Let's take a walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See. It's four in the morning. A  walk sounds a little screwy to me,  if you don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need an excuse, there's a  bakery on the corner. There's a  shot it'll open soon -- that way  we're not screwy -- we're just  two people who like warm rolls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk quietly -- Melvin still walking with his usual  attention to where he steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melvin walking -- and though we can see an improvement -- it is still decidedly strange as he conspicuously avoids  stepping on the lines.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Carol sighs. It is the sound of possibilities crashing  down. Melvin looks at her -- embarrassed, self-conscious  -- his habits making him appear unworthy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently; almost  lovingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Melvin -- but whatever  this is -- is not going to work.

dialogues.speaker: ON MELVIN
dialogues.text: He takes this hard. It forces him to half-whisper  something he hasn't at all said to himself... given his  history... this is an extraordinary intimacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm feeling... I've been feeling  better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melvin, even though it may seem  that way now -- you don't know me  all that well...  (as he scoffs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not the answer for you. She starts to turn. He tugs at her arm. As she turns  back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I've got a great compliment  for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let me talk. (gathers himself  with uncertainty,  then:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the only one on the face of  the earth who realizes that you're  the greatest woman on earth. I'm  the only one who appreciates how  amazing you are in every single  thing you do -- in every single  thought you have... in how you  are with Spencer -- Spence...  (he has reached  her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... in how you say what you mean  and how you almost always mean  something that's all about being  straight and good...

dialogues.speaker: ON CAROL
dialogues.text: She stands on the precipice of being transported away  from the logic which has been her lifeline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think most people miss that  about you and I watch wondering  how they can watch you bring them  food and clear their dishes and  never get that they have just met  the greatest woman alive... And  the fact that I get it makes me  feel great... about me! (a real question  filled with  concern for her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a real good reason to walk  out on that? That last question clearly a true question, not the least rhetorical -- she considers her answer, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! It's certainly not. No -- I  don't think so. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tentatively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna grab you. (with conviction)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean it to be a question.  I'm gonna grab you. He kisses her. An awkward bomb of a kiss. They separate.  A tense beat. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I can do better. They embrace again. He does indeed do much better. A  first-class smooch. CAMERA MOVES DOWN to see his foot  land squarely on a crack in the sidewalk without his  knowledge. They break -- look at each other without a  notion of where to take it from here, and the ALMOST in  unison begin to walk away FROM CAMERA, Melvin following a path that avoids cracks. Suddenly the lights of the  bakery turn on as it opens for business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warm rolls...  They walk to the bakery, Melvin avoiding the cracks. As  they enter the bakery, a WORKER moves toward them to  clean the entranceway. Melvin, forced to step back onto  a crack, this time notices -- registers the momentous  fact and joins Carol inside as we:
